Myocardial Infarction.description: A heart attack occurs when blood flow to part of the heart muscle is blocked, causing tissue damage.

Atrial Fibrillation.description: An irregular and often rapid heart rhythm that can lead to blood clots in the heart.

Congestive Heart Failure.description: A chronic condition where the heart doesn't pump blood efficiently, causing fluid buildup.
Congestive Heart Failure.seek_care: See a cardiologist soon; ER if symptoms worsen suddenly

Hypertension.description: Persistently elevated blood pressure that can damage blood vessels and organs over time.

Chronic Obstructive Pulmonary Disease.description: A group of progressive lung diseases (emphysema, chronic bronchitis) causing airflow obstruction.

Asthma.description: A chronic condition causing airway inflammation, swelling, and narrowing with episodic attacks.
Asthma.seek_care: See a doctor for management plan; ER if severe attack

Pneumonia.description: An infection that inflames air sacs in the lungs, which may fill with fluid or pus.
Pneumonia.seek_care: See a doctor within 24 hours; ER if breathing difficulty

Pulmonary Embolism.description: A blood clot that travels to the lungs, blocking blood flow and potentially life-threatening.

Influenza.description: A viral respiratory infection causing fever, body aches, and respiratory symptoms.
Influenza.seek_care: Rest and fluids; see a doctor if symptoms are severe

Common Cold.description: A mild viral infection of the upper respiratory tract causing nasal symptoms.

Meningitis.description: Inflammation of the membranes surrounding the brain and spinal cord, often due to infection.

Migraine.description: A neurological condition causing intense, debilitating headaches often with sensory disturbances.
Migraine.seek_care: See a neurologist for recurring episodes

Stroke.description: A medical emergency where blood supply to part of the brain is interrupted or reduced.

Epilepsy.description: A neurological disorder causing recurrent, unprovoked seizures due to abnormal brain activity.
Epilepsy.seek_care: See a neurologist for diagnosis and management

Alzheimer's Disease.description: A progressive brain disorder causing memory loss, cognitive decline, and behavioral changes.
Alzheimer's Disease.seek_care: See a neurologist or geriatric specialist

Appendicitis.description: Inflammation of the appendix causing severe abdominal pain, often requiring surgical removal.
Appendicitis.seek_care: Go to the emergency room immediately

Gastroesophageal Reflux Disease.description: Chronic acid reflux where stomach acid frequently flows back into the esophagus.
Gastroesophageal Reflux Disease.seek_care: See a gastroenterologist for persistent symptoms

Acute Pancreatitis.description: Sudden inflammation of the pancreas causing severe abdominal pain, often related to alcohol or gallstones.

Gastroenteritis.description: Inflammation of the stomach and intestines, typically caused by viral or bacterial infection.
Gastroenteritis.seek_care: Rest and hydration; see doctor if symptoms persist >48h

Cholelithiasis.description: Gallstones that form in the gallbladder, causing pain especially after fatty meals.
Cholelithiasis.seek_care: See a gastroenterologist; ER if severe pain or fever

Irritable Bowel Syndrome.description: A functional GI disorder causing cramping, bloating, and altered bowel habits without structural damage.

Type 2 Diabetes.description: A chronic metabolic disorder where the body becomes resistant to insulin or doesn't produce enough.

Type 1 Diabetes.description: An autoimmune condition where the pancreas produces little or no insulin.
Type 1 Diabetes.seek_care: See an endocrinologist urgently; ER if ketoacidosis suspected

Hypothyroidism.description: Underactive thyroid gland that doesn't produce enough thyroid hormones.
Hypothyroidism.seek_care: See a doctor for thyroid function tests

Hyperthyroidism.description: Overactive thyroid gland producing excess thyroid hormones, accelerating metabolism.

Dengue Fever.description: A mosquito-borne viral infection causing high fever, severe pain, and potential hemorrhagic complications.
Dengue Fever.seek_care: See a doctor immediately; monitor for warning signs

Malaria.description: A parasitic disease transmitted by mosquitoes causing cyclical fevers and potentially fatal complications.
Malaria.seek_care: See a doctor immediately for blood smear test

Tuberculosis.description: A bacterial infection primarily affecting the lungs, spread through airborne droplets.
Tuberculosis.seek_care: See a doctor for TB testing and treatment

COVID-19.description: A respiratory illness caused by SARS-CoV-2 with wide-ranging symptoms from mild to severe.
COVID-19.seek_care: Isolate and see a doctor if symptoms worsen

Strep Throat.description: A bacterial throat infection causing severe sore throat, fever, and swollen lymph nodes.
Strep Throat.seek_care: See a doctor for rapid strep test and antibiotics

Urinary Tract Infection.description: A bacterial infection in the urinary system, most commonly affecting the bladder.
Urinary Tract Infection.seek_care: See a doctor for urine culture and antibiotics

Psoriasis.description: A chronic autoimmune skin condition causing rapid skin cell buildup forming scales and red patches.

Eczema.description: A chronic inflammatory skin condition causing itchy, red, dry, and cracked skin.
Eczema.seek_care: See a dermatologist if over-the-counter treatments fail

Melanoma.description: The most serious type of skin cancer, developing in melanocytes (pigment-producing cells).
Melanoma.seek_care: See a dermatologist urgently for biopsy

Dermatophytosis.description: A fungal skin infection (ringworm) causing circular, red, scaly patches on the skin.
Dermatophytosis.seek_care: See a doctor if topical antifungals don't resolve it

Rheumatoid Arthritis.description: An autoimmune disorder causing chronic joint inflammation, primarily affecting hands and feet.
Rheumatoid Arthritis.seek_care: See a rheumatologist for early treatment

Osteoarthritis.description: Degenerative joint disease where cartilage breaks down, causing pain and stiffness.
Osteoarthritis.seek_care: See an orthopedist for management plan

Gout.description: A form of inflammatory arthritis caused by excess uric acid crystal deposits in joints.
Gout.seek_care: See a rheumatologist; ER for first acute attack

Lumbar Disc Herniation.description: A spinal disc pushes through its outer ring, pressing on nerves causing pain and numbness.

Fibromyalgia.description: A chronic condition causing widespread pain, fatigue, and cognitive difficulties.
Fibromyalgia.seek_care: See a rheumatologist for diagnosis and management

Major Depressive Disorder.description: A mood disorder causing persistent feelings of sadness and loss of interest.
Major Depressive Disorder.seek_care: See a psychiatrist or psychologist; crisis line if suicidal

Generalized Anxiety Disorder.description: Excessive, persistent worry about various aspects of life that is difficult to control.

Panic Disorder.description: Recurrent unexpected panic attacks with intense fear and physical symptoms.
Panic Disorder.seek_care: See a psychiatrist; ER if heart attack symptoms

Kidney Stones.description: Hard mineral deposits that form in the kidneys and cause severe pain when passing through the urinary tract.
Kidney Stones.seek_care: See a urologist; ER if severe pain or complete obstruction

Chronic Kidney Disease.description: Progressive loss of kidney function over months or years.
Chronic Kidney Disease.seek_care: See a nephrologist for ongoing management

Hepatitis.description: Inflammation of the liver, commonly caused by viral infections, alcohol, or toxins.
